definition: extending in the same direction, everywhere equidistant (see equidistant sense 1), and not meeting; everywhere equally distant; having parallel sides; being or relating to an electrical circuit having a number of conductors (see conductor sense d(1)) in parallel (see parallel entry 2 sense 4b); arranged in parallel; relating to or being a connection in a computer system in which the bits of a byte are transmitted over separate channels at the same time; similar, analogous, or interdependent in tendency or development- exhibiting parallelism in form, function, or development; see also parallel evolution; having identical syntactical elements in corresponding positions; being such an element; having the same tonic; keeping the same distance apart in musical pitch (see pitch entry 4 sense 4b(1)); performed while keeping one's skis parallel; a parallel line, curve, or surface; one of the imaginary circles on the surface of the earth paralleling the equator and marking the latitude; the corresponding line on a globe or map   see latitude illustration; a character ∥ used in printing especially as a reference mark; something equal or similar in all essential particulars; a comparison to show resemblance; the state of being physically parallel; an arrangement of electrical devices in a circuit in which the same potential difference is applied to two or more resistances with each resistance being on a different branch of the circuit   compare series; an arrangement or state that permits several operations or tasks to be performed simultaneously rather than consecutively; to indicate analogy of; to show something equal to; to correspond to; to place so as to be parallel in direction with something; to extend, run, or move in a direction parallel to; in a parallel manner

showing little forethought or preparation; marked by ease and informality; lacking depth and substance; marked by ease and fluency in speaking or writing often to the point of being insincere or deceitful
example: Or they could have saddled us with "The Stranger," which had the mitigating charm of being glib and pretentious and would thus have kept the kids who were obviously going to end up at Bard happy.

definition: a composition usually in verse in which sets of letters (such as the initial or final letters of the lines) taken in order form a word or phrase or a regular sequence of letters of the alphabet

to dull or destroy the luster of by or as if by air, dust, or dirt; to detract from the good quality of; to bring disgrace on; to become tarnished; something that tarnishes; a film of chemically altered material on the surface of a metal (such as silver)
example: Some foods will tarnish silver.

definition: something given or received for something else; a deal arranging a quid pro quo

definition: blustering swaggering conduct; a pretense of bravery; the quality or state of being foolhardy

definition: anger and bitterness- harsh or biting sharpness especially of words, manner, or feelings

definition: vigorous spirit or enthusiasm

definition: a person having a superficial interest in an art or a branch of knowledge; an admirer or lover of the arts

I finished the course (I was enrolled in a course) thinking that perhaps I am better off remaining a slightly-above-average mountain dilettante. An occasional rock climber.

definition: a very steep or overhanging place; a hazardous situation
example: Twenty years ago, it seemed unlikely that black and white South Africans could avoid a cataclysmic struggle. How did we manage to turn back from the precipice and join one another in the long walk to a nonracial democracy?

definition: to exile by ostracism; to exclude from a group by common consent

definition: apt to let things fall or slip through the fingers

definition: to coin into money; to establish as legal tender; to purchase (public or private debt) and thereby free for other uses moneys that would have been devoted to debt service; to utilize (something of value) as a source of profit
a servile self-seeking flatterer
example: His press conference on January 11 was all aimed toward a single moment. The President was at his rostrum at the Élysée, with a crowd of courtiers, journalists, and sycophants herded behind a velvet rope. One reporter was allowed across the rope to put the same question, in exactly the same words, as he had put when Chirac had been nearing the end of his first term: Would he perhaps consider standing for a further five years?

definition: the condition of being lost in thought
example: I was lost in reverie and didn't realize my flight was boarding until it was almost too late.

definition: containing more words than necessary; impaired by wordiness; given to wordiness

definition: something that helps to provide comfort, convenience, or enjoyment; something (such as a conventional social gesture) that promotes smoothness or pleasantness in social relationships; the quality of being pleasant or agreeable; the attractiveness and value of real estate or of a residential structure; a feature conducive to such attractiveness and value
example: The hotel has every amenity you could want.

definition: a concise poem dealing pointedly and often satirically with a single thought or event and often ending with an ingenious turn of thought; a terse, sage, or witty and often paradoxical saying
example: Benjamin Franklin's famous epigram, “Remember that time is money”.

definition: a science that deals with the production, control, transmission, reception, and effects of sound; the qualities that determine the ability of an enclosure (such as an auditorium) to reflect sound waves in such a way as to produce distinct hearing
joking or jesting often inappropriately; meant to be humorous or funny
example: The portrait is good, the prose embroidered here with the facetious parlance—is that the word?—of clubs.

definition: the transitional movement in Europe between medieval and modern times beginning in the 14th century in Italy, lasting into the 17th century, and marked by a humanistic revival of classical influence expressed in a flowering of the arts and literature and by the beginnings of modern science; the period of the Renaissance; the neoclassical style of architecture prevailing during the Renaissance; a movement or period of vigorous artistic and intellectual activity
example: a book on the Renaissance

definition: marked by disorder or disarray

definition: a feeling of anxiety, apprehension, or insecurity; to feel or express anxiety, apprehension, or insecurity- to experience or express angst

definition: of, relating to, or resembling a monolith; formed from a single crystal; produced in or on a monolithic chip (see chip entry 1 sense 6b); cast as a single piece; formed or composed of material without joints or seams; consisting of or constituting a single unit; constituting a massive undifferentiated and often rigid whole; exhibiting or characterized by often rigidly fixed uniformity
characterized by routine or superficiality; lacking in interest or enthusiasm

definition: a seismograph measuring the actual movements of the ground (as on the earth or the moon)
an athletic contest that is a long-distance race consisting of three phases (such as swimming, bicycling, and running)
a flock of geese when not in flight   compare skein; a group, aggregation, or cluster lacking organization; an indefinite number

definition: showing or suggesting that future success is likely; attended by good auspices

definition: an expression in the usage of a language that is peculiar to itself either in having a meaning that cannot be derived from the conjoined meanings of its elements (such as up in the air for "undecided") or in its grammatically atypical use of words (such as give way); the language peculiar to a people or to a district, community, or class; the syntactical, grammatical, or structural form peculiar to a language; a style or form of artistic expression that is characteristic of an individual, a period or movement, or a medium or instrument

definition: a remedy for all ills or difficulties

definition: lasting a very short time; lasting one day only; something that lasts for a very short time; a plant that grows, flowers, and dies in a few days

definition: software designed to interfere with a computer's normal functioning

a thin sheet of a material; a layer of wood of superior value or excellent grain to be glued to an inferior wood; any of the thin layers bonded together to form plywood; a plastic or porcelain coating bonded to the surface of a cosmetically imperfect tooth; a protective or ornamental facing (as of brick or stone); a superficial or deceptively attractive appearance, display, or effect; to overlay or plate (a surface, as of a common sort of wood) with a thin layer of finer wood for outer finish or decoration; to face with a material giving a superior surface; to cover over with a veneer; to conceal (something, such as a defect of character) under a superficial and deceptive attractiveness

definition: the final beatitude (see beatitude sense 1a) that transcends suffering, karma, and samsara and is sought especially in Buddhism through the extinction of desire and individual consciousness; a place or state of oblivion to care, pain, or external reality; a goal hoped for but apparently unattainable
example: the spa experience was a week of pure nirvana

definition: full discretionary (see discretion sense 1a) power

definition: being a usually artificial and inferior substitute or imitation

definition: to use equivocal language especially with intent to deceive; to avoid committing oneself in what one says

definition: one who favors restricting the functions and powers of a political organization or the achievement of a set of goals to a minimum; an artist who creates minimal art; an adherent of minimalism; of, relating to, or done in the style of minimalism
a protracted speech usually marked by intemperate, vituperative, or harshly censorious language
example: He went into a tirade about the failures of the government.

definition: the implicit or metaphorical meaning (as of a literary text)
an instrument that imparts a buzzing quality to the human voice and that usually consists of a small metal or plastic tube with a side hole covered by a thin membrane
a complete failure; a bulbous long-necked straw-covered bottle for wine

definition: a division into two especially mutually exclusive or contradictory groups or entities; the process or practice of making such a division; something with seemingly contradictory qualities; the phase of the moon or an inferior planet in which half its disk appears illuminated; repeated bifurcation (as of a plant's stem); a system of branching in which the main axis forks repeatedly into two branches; branching of an ancestral line into two equal diverging branches
example: The amusing spectacle of the recent presidential vote in Florida should remind us of the persistence of the federal-state dichotomy.

definition: the act or action of empowering someone or something- the granting of the power, right, or authority to perform various acts or duties; the state of being empowered to do something- the power, right, or authority to do something
example: the empowerment of her husband to make medical decisions on her behalf is clearly stated in her living will

definition: attracting or seeking to attract attention, admiration, or envy often by gaudiness or obviousness- overly elaborate or conspicuous- characterized by, fond of, or evincing ostentation

definition: having or showing tact
example: He gave a tactful critique of her story.

definition: to move or go lightly on or as if on a buoyant medium; to cause to move or go lightly by or as if by the impulse of wind or waves; something (such as an odor) that is wafted; a slight breeze; the act of waving; a pennant or flag used to signal or to show wind direction

definition: pleasing or picturesque in natural simplicity; of, relating to, or being an idyll

definition: a specialist in cryptography; a clerk who enciphers and deciphers messages; one who devises cryptographic methods or systems

definition: being adverse often by reason of hostility or malevolence; having the disposition of an enemy; reflecting or indicating hostility

definition: characterized by profuse or wasteful expenditure; one who spends or gives lavishly and foolishly; one who has returned after an absence

definition: having a gradual and cumulative effect; developing so gradually as to be well established before becoming apparent; awaiting a chance to entrap; harmful but enticing

definition: smoothly though often superficially gracious and sophisticated; smooth in texture, performance, or style

definition: good-natured easy friendliness

definition: a name that a writer uses instead of his or her real name- pseudonym, pen name

definition: containing, expressing, using, or relating to exclamation
having or showing knowledge that is gained by studying- possessing or displaying erudition

definition: a spirit of friendly good-fellowship

of, relating to, or having the characteristics of a style of artistic expression prevalent especially in the 17th century that is marked generally by use of complex forms, bold ornamentation, and the juxtaposition of contrasting elements often conveying a sense of drama, movement, and tension; characterized by grotesqueness, extravagance, complexity, or flamboyance; the baroque style or the period in which it flourished

definition: morally despicable or abhorrent; of little worth or account; tending to degrade; disgustingly or utterly bad

definition: the fact or condition of not remembering- a state marked by lack of awareness or consciousness; the condition or state of being forgotten or unknown

definition: of little value; a Spanish half real piece formerly current in the South

definition: the place where something is situated or occurs; a center of activity, attention, or concentration; the set of all points whose location is determined by stated conditions; the position in a chromosome of a particular gene or allele

definition: capable of existing together in harmony; capable of cross-fertilizing freely or uniting vegetatively; capable of forming a homogeneous mixture that neither separates nor is altered by chemical interaction; capable of being used in transfusion or grafting without reaction (such as agglutination or tissue rejection); designed to work with another device or system without modification; being a computer designed to operate in the same manner and use the same software as another computer; a device (such as a computer) or system designed to be used with another device or system without modification
example: two people with compatible personalities

definition: to apply varnish to; to cover or conceal (something, such as something unpleasant) with something that gives an attractive appearance- gloss entry 2; a liquid preparation that when applied to a surface dries to form a hard lustrous typically transparent coating; the covering or glaze given by the application of varnish; something that suggests varnish by its gloss; a coating (as of deposits in an internal combustion engine) comparable to varnish; gloss entry 1; a liquid nail polish

I know nothing about her except that she lived in New York at the same time I did, and that she and I subscribed to a few of the same publications. I found myself in the surreal position of having to explain to circulation departments that I was, in fact, me, and not that other version of me on the West Side.

definition: to call forth or draw out (something, such as information or a response); to draw forth or bring out (something latent or potential)

definition: not to be avoided or evaded; of, relating to, or constituting the grammatical mood that expresses the will to influence the behavior of another; expressive of a command, entreaty, or exhortation; having power to restrain, control, and direct; something that is imperative (see imperative entry 1); an obligatory act or duty; an obligatory judgment or proposition; the grammatical mood that expresses the will to influence the behavior of another or a verb form or verbal phrase expressing it

definition: in an express manner; for the express purpose
showing or expressing dignity

definition: to withdraw (oneself) from residence in or allegiance to one's native country; to leave one's native country to live elsewhere; to renounce allegiance to one's native country; living in a foreign land; a person who lives in a foreign country

definition: markedly distinct in quality or character; containing or made up of fundamentally different and often incongruous elements

definition: having the characteristics of the language of the past and surviving chiefly in specialized uses; of, relating to, or characteristic of an earlier or more primitive time; of or belonging to the early or formative phases of a culture or a period of artistic development; of or belonging to the period leading up to the classical period of Greek culture; surviving from an earlier period; typical of a previously dominant evolutionary stage; of or relating to the period from about 8000 b.c. to 1000 b.c. and the North American cultures of that time

definition: involving, characterized by, or based on empathy

definition: marked by or calling for energy or stamina

definition: existing in, belonging to, or determined by factors present in an individual from birth; belonging to the essential nature of something; originating in or derived from the mind or the constitution of the intellect rather than from experience

definition: marked by rancor

definition: a market (as in the Middle East) consisting of rows of shops or stalls selling miscellaneous goods; a place for the sale of goods; a fair for the sale of articles especially for charitable purposes

definition: to make a reconnaissance of; to engage in reconnaissance

definition: exciting pity or sympathy

definition: one that interlopes; one that intrudes in a place or sphere of activity; an illegal or unlicensed trader

definition: to offer for discussion or consideration

example: He lived a hardscrabble life.

definition: of moderate or low quality, value, ability, or performance

definition: extensive knowledge acquired chiefly from books- profound, recondite, or bookish learning
example: a scholar of remarkable erudition

definition: a way or place for passage; a street open at both ends; a main road; the conditions necessary for passing through

definition: a seal used especially as a mark of official approval; an indication of approval carrying great prestige; a characteristic feature or quality conferring prestige; a medicinal preparation for swallowing consisting of a case usually of rice-flour paste enclosing a medicine; a design or inscription on an envelope to commemorate a postal or philatelic event; an advertisement forming part of a postage meter impression; a motto or slogan included in a postal cancellation (see cancellation sense 3)

incapable of being explained, interpreted, or accounted for

definition: having no definite form; being without definite character or nature; lacking organization or unity; having no real or apparent crystalline form

definition: the human body apart from the head, neck, arms, and legs- the human trunk; a sculptured representation of the trunk of a human body; something (such as a piece of writing) that is mutilated or left unfinished

definition: causing damage, wear, or removal of surface material by grinding or rubbing- tending to abrade; a substance (such as emery or pumice) used for abrading, smoothing, or polishing
example: The waves had an abrasive action on the rocks.

definition: a cloth covering suspended over a bed; a cover (as of cloth) fixed or carried above a person of high rank or a sacred object; a protective covering; the uppermost spreading branchy layer of a forest; an ornamental rooflike structure; the transparent enclosure over an airplane cockpit; the fabric part of a parachute that catches the air; to cover with or as if with a canopy
example: A canopy hung over the altar.

definition: to write, engrave, or print as a lasting record; to enter on a list; to write, engrave, or print characters upon; to autograph or address (a book) as a gift; to dedicate to someone; to draw within a figure so as to touch in as many places as possible; to register the name of the holder of (a security)
example: They inscribed the monument with the soldiers' names.

definition: a person who has recently started a particular activity- beginner, novice, newcomer
example: He is a newbie to local politics.

definition: of, relating to, or proceeding from a root; of or growing from the root of a plant; growing from the base of a stem, from a rootlike stem, or from a stem that does not rise above the ground; of, relating to, or constituting a linguistic root; of or relating to a mathematical root; designed to remove the root of a disease or all diseased and potentially diseased tissue; of or relating to the origin; very different from the usual or traditional; favoring extreme changes in existing views, habits, conditions, or institutions; associated with political views, practices, and policies of extreme change; advocating extreme measures to retain or restore a political state of affairs; a root part; a basic principle; root sense 6; a sound or letter belonging to a radical; one who is radical; a group of atoms bonded together that is considered an entity in various kinds of reactions or as a subunit of a larger molecule; a mathematical expression indicating a root by means of a radical sign
example: The computer has introduced radical innovations.

definition: of or relating to a father; like that of a father; received or inherited from one's male parent; related through one's father
example: He did not neglect his paternal responsibilities after the divorce.

definition: providing or being group services or facilities designed especially for elderly persons requiring supportive services; to collect into a group or crowd; to come together into a group, crowd, or assembly
example: It's a place where the homeless congregate.

definition: an inherited, established, or customary pattern of thought, action, or behavior (such as a religious practice or a social custom); a belief or story or a body of beliefs or stories relating to the past that are commonly accepted as historical though not verifiable; the handing down of information, beliefs, and customs by word of mouth or by example from one generation to another without written instruction; cultural continuity in social attitudes, customs, and institutions; characteristic manner, method, or style
example: One of our town's time-honored traditions is to have an Easter egg hunt the week before Easter.

definition: of, relating to, or characteristic of congenial neighbors
example: She was friendly in a neighborly way.

definition: to hold fast or stick by or as if by gluing, suction, grasping, or fusing; to give support or maintain loyalty; to bind oneself to observance; accord sense intransitive 1; to cause to stick fast
example: The stamp failed to adhere.

definition: pleasing to the ear
example: an opera singer with an appropriately euphonious name

definition: an item of food; a choice or tasty dish
example: a shop selling caviar, foie gras, designer chocolates, and other pricey viands

definition: the fruit of a central Asian tree (Cydonia oblonga) of the rose family that resembles a hard-fleshed yellow apple and is used especially in preserves; a tree that bears quinces   compare Japanese quince
a grayish-yellow green; a ceramic glaze originated in China that is greenish in color; an article with a celadon glaze
involving a random variable; involving chance or probability
a thicket, grove, or growth of small trees
example: a small copse of trees shaded the back of the house

definition: a loosely coiled length of yarn or thread wound on a reel; something suggesting the twists or coils of a skein; a flock of wildfowl (such as geese or ducks) in flight; to wind into skeins
made unclear or confusing- distorted or mixed up
something (such as a tree or fruit) blown down by the wind; an unexpected, unearned, or sudden gain or advantage
example: They received a windfall because of the tax cuts.

definition: marked by or given to vehement insistent outcry
example: He is her most vociferous critic.

definition: a place where old clothes are sold; an elegant or showy garment; something showy, frivolous, or nonessential; something foolish or affectedly elegant
example: The design is simple and devoid of needless frippery.

definition: unwieldy because of heaviness and bulk
example: Squad members, already decked out in cumbersome chemical suits, put on masks and rubber gloves.

definition: covering the main points succinctly; done without delay or formality; of, relating to, or using a summary proceeding; an abstract, abridgment, or compendium especially of a preceding discourse
example: a summary account of the accident

definition: to destroy completely; to pull up by the root; to cut out by surgery
example: the triumph of modern medicine in extirpating certain diseases

definition: the nest of a bird on a cliff or a mountaintop; a brood of birds of prey; an elevated often secluded dwelling, structure, or position

of, relating to, or using gas (such as air or wind); moved or worked by air pressure; adapted for holding or inflated with compressed air; having air-filled cavities; of or relating to the pneuma; having a well-proportioned feminine figure; having a full bust
example: a movie star who is remembered mainly as a pneumatic sex symbol of the 1950s

definition: to make an official decision about who is right in (a dispute)- to settle judicially; to act as judge
example: The board will adjudicate claims made against teachers.

definition: expressive of opprobrium; deserving of opprobrium
example: an opprobrious attack on the alleged corruption in the police department

definition: the language used by a particular type or group of people- an often more or less secret vocabulary and idiom peculiar to a particular group
example: groups communicating in their own secret argots

definition: a loud or boisterous burst of laughter
example: managed to keep a straight face for a minute before he let loose with a loud guffaw

definition: a large knife; a trench which was originally worn in the earth by running water and through which water often runs after rains; a small valley or gulch; to make gullies in; to undergo erosion
extravagant exaggeration (such as "mile-high ice-cream cones")
example: The plea was a bit of hyperbole, but there was truth in it.

definition: of, relating to, or supported by charity
example: used his vast fortune for establishing and funding a host of eleemosynary institutions

definition: a carving or inscription on a rock
not favored by the stars
example: Romeo and Juliet are among literature's most famous star-crossed lovers

definition: a dance or figure for two performers; an intricate relationship or activity involving two parties or things

a large tent set up for an outdoor party, reception, or exhibition; a permanent canopy often of metal and glass projecting over an entrance (as of a hotel or theater); a sign usually over the entrance of a theater or arena that displays the names of featured attractions and principal performers; having or associated with the name recognition and attraction of one whose name appears on a marquee
example: She dreamed of seeing her name on the theater marquee.

definition: beaming and bright with optimism, promise, or achievement

the quality or state of being changeable; natural change or mutation visible in nature or in human affairs; a favorable or unfavorable event or situation that occurs by chance- a fluctuation of state or condition; a difficulty or hardship attendant on a way of life, a career, or a course of action and usually beyond one's control
a descriptive name or epithet
example: Baseball player Ty Cobb was also known by the sobriquet “The Georgia Peach.”

definition: marked by overwrought or exaggerated emotion
example: the perfervid prose of a romance novel

definition: capable of being perceived especially by the sense of touch; capable of being precisely identified or realized by the mind; capable of being appraised at an actual or approximate value; something that is tangible (see tangible entry 1); an asset capable of being appraised at an actual or approximate value
example: These days, an environmentally conscious motorist can walk into a Toyota or Honda dealer and snap up an efficient gasoline-electric hybrid, but the omega point of green driving—the pollution-free hydrogen fuel cell vehicle—is so elusive that one wonders if it will ever become tangible.

definition: a roofed porch
example: a low-slung Hawaiian beach house with an open-sided lanai to catch the tropical breezes

definition: an iron golf club with a wide deeply slanted face used for short shots out of sand or long grass or for shots where quick loft and little roll is desired
a grassland especially of southern Africa usually with scattered shrubs or trees
example: lions prowling the African veld

definition: of, relating to, or written in a simplified form of the ancient Egyptian hieratic writing; of or relating to the form of Modern Greek that is based on everyday speech
example: a more demotic way of speaking

definition: an object (such as an animal or plant) serving as the emblem of a family or clan and often as a reminder of its ancestry; a usually carved or painted representation of such an object; a family or clan identified by a common totemic object; one that serves as an emblem or revered symbol
example: Private jets are a totem of success among extremely wealthy people.

definition: one having or affecting sensitivity to the beautiful especially in art
example: He regards art critics as a bunch of pretentious aesthetes.

definition: one of two or more words spelled and pronounced alike but different in meaning (such as the noun quail and the verb quail); a taxonomic designation rejected as invalid because the identical term has been used to designate another group of the same rank   compare synonym
example: The noun “bear” and the verb “bear” are homonyms.

definition: a small piece of apparatus which typically consists of a narrow tube into which fluid is drawn by suction (as for dispensing or measurement) and retained by closing the upper end
a creator or writer of fables
example: a once highly admired journalist whose reputation is now that of a disgraced fabulist

definition: marked by or concerned about precise accordance with the details of codes or conventions
example: She's very punctilious about grammar.

definition: a brief summary of a larger work or of a field of knowledge; a list of a number of items
example: a one-volume compendium of information

definition: marked by forceful energy
example: Cranes rise above the old rooftops, adding new office towers and new condominiums and new malls to a city where Jonathan Swift once issued his vehement bulletins.

definition: to wear off the skin of; to censure scathingly
example: He was excoriated as a racist.

definition: a sudden copious rainfall; a sudden outpouring
example: A cloudburst caused the river to flood.

definition: a scene or place characterized by frivolity and ostentation
the description or study of the phenomena of death and of psychological mechanisms for coping with them
a figure in Roman mythology similar to but gentler than the satyr

any of various small images, symbols, or icons used in text fields in electronic communication (as in text messages, email, and social media) to express the emotional attitude of the writer, convey information succinctly, communicate a message playfully without using words, etc.

an agreement, combination, or group (as of companies) formed to undertake an enterprise beyond the resources of any one member; the legal right of one spouse to the company, affection, and assistance of and to sexual relations with the other
example: A Japanese consortium invested millions in the technology.
